verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.web: LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD spoke to Moses and said,

verses.kjv: Speak unto the children of Israel, and say unto them, When ye be come into the land of your habitations, which I give unto you,
verses.web: “Speak to the children of Israel, and tell them, ‘When you have come into the land of your habitations, which I give to you,
verses.ct: "Tell the people of Israel: When you finally enter the land I'm giving you to live in,

verses.kjv: And will make an offering by fire unto the LORD, a burnt offering, or a sacrifice in performing a vow, or in a freewill offering, or in your solemn feasts, to make a sweet savour unto the LORD, of the herd, or of the flock:
verses.web: and will make an offering by fire to LORD—a burnt offering, or a sacrifice, to accomplish a vow, or as a free will offering, or in your set feasts, to make a pleasant aroma to LORD, of the herd, or of the flock—
verses.ct: and you present a fire offering to the LORD — whether a burnt offering or a sacrifice to fulfill a vow, a freewill offering, or an offering during one of your appointed festivals — producing a pleasing aroma to the LORD from your cattle or flocks,

verses.kjv: Then shall he that offereth his offering unto the LORD bring a meat offering of a tenth deal of flour mingled with the fourth part of an hin of oil.
verses.web: then he who offers his offering shall offer to LORD a meal offering of one tenth of an ephah of fine flour mixed with one fourth of a hin of oil.
verses.ct: the person bringing the offering must also present a grain offering of 1/10 of an ephah of fine flour mixed with 1/4 of a hin of oil.

verses.kjv: And the fourth part of an hin of wine for a drink offering shalt thou prepare with the burnt offering or sacrifice, for one lamb.
verses.web: You shall prepare wine for the drink offering, one fourth of a hin, with the burnt offering or for the sacrifice, for each lamb.
verses.ct: Along with each lamb, you must also prepare 1/4 of a hin of wine as a drink offering, whether it accompanies a burnt offering or any other sacrifice.

verses.kjv: Or for a ram, thou shalt prepare for a meat offering two tenth deals of flour mingled with the third part of an hin of oil.
verses.web: “ ‘For a ram, you shall prepare for a meal offering two tenths of an ephah of fine flour mixed with the third part of a hin of oil;
verses.ct: If the offering is a ram, prepare a grain offering of 2/10 of an ephah of fine flour mixed with 1/3 of a hin of oil.

verses.kjv: And for a drink offering thou shalt offer the third part of an hin of wine, for a sweet savour unto the LORD.
verses.web: and for the drink offering you shall offer the third part of a hin of wine, of a pleasant aroma to LORD.
verses.ct: For the drink offering, present 1/3 of a hin of wine as a pleasing aroma to the LORD.

verses.kjv: And when thou preparest a bullock for a burnt offering, or for a sacrifice in performing a vow, or peace offerings unto the LORD:
verses.web: When you prepare a bull for a burnt offering or for a sacrifice, to accomplish a vow, or for peace offerings to LORD,
verses.ct: When you prepare a bull as a burnt offering, as a sacrifice to fulfill a vow, or as a peace offering to the LORD,

verses.kjv: Then shall he bring with a bullock a meat offering of three tenth deals of flour mingled with half an hin of oil.
verses.web: then he shall offer with the bull a meal offering of three tenths of an ephah of fine flour mixed with half a hin of oil;
verses.ct: you must bring along a grain offering of 3/10 of an ephah of fine flour mixed with 1/2 a hin of oil.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt bring for a drink offering half an hin of wine, for an offering made by fire, of a sweet savour unto the LORD.
verses.web: and you shall offer for the drink offering half a hin of wine, for an offering made by fire, of a pleasant aroma to LORD.
verses.ct: Also present 1/2 a hin of wine as a drink offering. This is a fire offering that produces a pleasing aroma to the LORD.

verses.kjv: Thus shall it be done for one bullock, or for one ram, or for a lamb, or a kid.
verses.web: Thus it shall be done for each bull, for each ram, for each of the male lambs, or of the young goats.
verses.ct: Follow these measurements for each bull, each ram, each lamb, or each young goat.

verses.kjv: According to the number that ye shall prepare, so shall ye do to every one according to their number.
verses.web: According to the number that you shall prepare, so you shall do to everyone according to their number.
verses.ct: However many animals you offer, prepare the proper grain and drink offering for each one.

verses.kjv: All that are born of the country shall do these things after this manner, in offering an offering made by fire, of a sweet savour unto the LORD.
verses.web: “ ‘All who are native-born shall do these things in this way, in offering an offering made by fire, of a pleasant aroma to LORD.
verses.ct: Every native-born Israelite must follow these instructions when presenting a fire offering as a pleasing aroma to the LORD.

verses.kjv: And if a stranger sojourn with you, or whosoever be among you in your generations, and will offer an offering made by fire, of a sweet savour unto the LORD; as ye do, so he shall do.
verses.web: If a stranger lives as a foreigner with you, or whoever may be among you throughout your generations, and will offer an offering made by fire, of a pleasant aroma to LORD, as you do, so he shall do.
verses.ct: If a foreigner living among you — whether now or in any future generation — wants to present a fire offering as a pleasing aroma to the LORD, he must follow the same instructions you do.

verses.kjv: One ordinance shall be both for you of the congregation, and also for the stranger that sojourneth with you, an ordinance for ever in your generations: as ye are, so shall the stranger be before the LORD.
verses.web: For the assembly, there shall be one statute for you and for the stranger who lives as a foreigner, a statute forever throughout your generations. As you are, so the foreigner shall be before LORD.
verses.ct: The same rule applies to everyone in the community, whether native-born or foreigner. This is a permanent law for all generations. In the LORD's eyes, you and the foreigner are equal.

verses.kjv: One law and one manner shall be for you, and for the stranger that sojourneth with you.
verses.web: One law and one ordinance shall be for you and for the stranger who lives as a foreigner with you.’ ”
verses.ct: One law and one standard applies to both you and any foreigner living among you."

verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.web: LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD spoke to Moses and said,

verses.kjv: Speak unto the children of Israel, and say unto them, When ye come into the land whither I bring you,
verses.web: “Speak to the children of Israel, and tell them, ‘When you come into the land where I bring you,
verses.ct: "Tell the people of Israel: When you arrive in the land where I am bringing you,

verses.kjv: Then it shall be, that, when ye eat of the bread of the land, ye shall offer up an heave offering unto the LORD.
verses.web: then it shall be that when you eat of the bread of the land, you shall offer up a wave offering to LORD.
verses.ct: and you begin eating food grown from that land, you must set aside a portion as an offering to the LORD.

verses.kjv: Ye shall offer up a cake of the first of your dough for an heave offering: as ye do the heave offering of the threshingfloor, so shall ye heave it.
verses.web: Of the first of your dough you shall offer up a cake for a wave offering. As the wave offering of the threshing floor, so you shall heave it.
verses.ct: From the first batch of your dough, present a cake as an offering — just as you present an offering from your threshing floor.

verses.kjv: Of the first of your dough ye shall give unto the LORD an heave offering in your generations.
verses.web: Of the first of your dough, you shall give to LORD a wave offering throughout your generations.
verses.ct: Throughout every generation, you must give the LORD an offering from the first of your dough.

verses.kjv: And if ye have erred, and not observed all these commandments, which the LORD hath spoken unto Moses,
verses.web: “ ‘When you err, and don’t observe all these commandments which LORD has spoken to Moses—
verses.ct: Now, if the community unintentionally fails to keep any of these commands that the LORD gave through Moses —

verses.kjv: Even all that the LORD hath commanded you by the hand of Moses, from the day that the LORD commanded Moses, and henceforward among your generations;
verses.web: even all that LORD has commanded you by Moses, from the day that LORD gave commandment and onward throughout your generations—
verses.ct: anything the LORD commanded through Moses from the time he first gave these instructions and for all generations to come —

verses.kjv: Then it shall be, if ought be committed by ignorance without the knowledge of the congregation, that all the congregation shall offer one young bullock for a burnt offering, for a sweet savour unto the LORD, with his meat offering, and his drink offering, according to the manner, and one kid of the goats for a sin offering.
verses.web: then it shall be, if it was done unwittingly, without the knowledge of the congregation, that all the congregation shall offer one young bull for a burnt offering, for a pleasant aroma to LORD, with its meal offering and its drink offering, according to the ordinance, and one male goat for a sin offering.
verses.ct: and if the sin was committed by accident without the community realizing it, then the entire community must offer one young bull as a burnt offering, a pleasing aroma to the LORD, along with its required grain offering and drink offering, plus one male goat as a sin offering.

verses.kjv: And the priest shall make an atonement for all the congregation of the children of Israel, and it shall be forgiven them; for it is ignorance: and they shall bring their offering, a sacrifice made by fire unto the LORD, and their sin offering before the LORD, for their ignorance:
verses.web: The priest shall make atonement for all the congregation of the children of Israel, and they shall be forgiven; for it was an error, and they have brought their offering, an offering made by fire to LORD, and their sin offering before LORD, for their error.
verses.ct: The priest will make atonement for the entire community of Israel, and they will be forgiven. It was an honest mistake, and they have brought their fire offering to the LORD along with their sin offering for their error.

verses.kjv: And it shall be forgiven all the congregation of the children of Israel, and the stranger that sojourneth among them; seeing all the people were in ignorance.
verses.web: All the congregation of the children of Israel shall be forgiven, as well as the stranger who lives as a foreigner among them; for with regard to all the people, it was done unwittingly.
verses.ct: The whole community of Israel will be forgiven, including any foreigners living among them, since the entire people sinned unintentionally.

verses.kjv: And if any soul sin through ignorance, then he shall bring a she goat of the first year for a sin offering.
verses.web: “ ‘If a person sins unwittingly, then he shall offer a female goat a year old for a sin offering.
verses.ct: If an individual sins unintentionally, that person must bring a 1-year-old female goat as a sin offering.

verses.kjv: And the priest shall make an atonement for the soul that sinneth ignorantly, when he sinneth by ignorance before the LORD, to make an atonement for him; and it shall be forgiven him.
verses.web: The priest shall make atonement for the soul who errs when he sins unwittingly before LORD. He shall make atonement for him; and he shall be forgiven.
verses.ct: The priest will make atonement before the LORD for the person who sinned unintentionally, and that person will be forgiven.

verses.kjv: Ye shall have one law for him that sinneth through ignorance, both for him that is born among the children of Israel, and for the stranger that sojourneth among them.
verses.web: You shall have one law for him who does anything unwittingly, for him who is native-born among the children of Israel, and for the stranger who lives as a foreigner among them.
verses.ct: The same law for unintentional sin applies to everyone — whether native-born Israelite or foreigner living among you.

verses.kjv: But the soul that doeth ought presumptuously, whether he be born in the land, or a stranger, the same reproacheth the LORD; and that soul shall be cut off from among his people.
verses.web: “ ‘But the soul who does anything with a high hand, whether he is native-born or a foreigner, blasphemes LORD. That soul shall be cut off from among his people.
verses.ct: But anyone who sins defiantly — whether native-born or foreigner — insults the LORD directly. That person must be cut off from the community.

verses.kjv: Because he hath despised the word of the LORD, and hath broken his commandment, that soul shall utterly be cut off; his iniquity shall be upon him.
verses.web: Because he has despised LORD’s word, and has broken his commandment, that soul shall be utterly cut off. His iniquity shall be on him.’ ”
verses.ct: Because that person treated the LORD's word with contempt and deliberately broke his commandment, they must be completely cut off. Their guilt remains on them."

verses.kjv: And while the children of Israel were in the wilderness, they found a man that gathered sticks upon the sabbath day.
verses.web: While the children of Israel were in the wilderness, they found a man gathering sticks on the Sabbath day.
verses.ct: While the Israelites were still in the wilderness, they caught a man gathering sticks on the Sabbath day.

verses.kjv: And they that found him gathering sticks brought him unto Moses and Aaron, and unto all the congregation.
verses.web: Those who found him gathering sticks brought him to Moses and Aaron, and to all the congregation.
verses.ct: The people who found him brought him to Moses, Aaron, and the whole community.

verses.kjv: And they put him in ward, because it was not declared what should be done to him.
verses.web: They put him in custody, because it had not been declared what should be done to him.
verses.ct: They held him in custody because no one had yet determined what his punishment should be.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Moses, The man shall be surely put to death: all the congregation shall stone him with stones without the camp.
verses.web: LORD said to Moses, “The man shall surely be put to death. All the congregation shall stone him with stones outside of the camp.”
verses.ct: Then the LORD told Moses, "This man must be put to death. The entire community must take him outside the camp and stone him."

verses.kjv: And all the congregation brought him without the camp, and stoned him with stones, and he died; as the LORD commanded Moses.
verses.web: All the congregation brought him outside of the camp, and stoned him to death with stones, as LORD commanded Moses.
verses.ct: So the whole community took him outside the camp and stoned him to death, just as the LORD had commanded Moses.

verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.web: LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD spoke to Moses and said,

verses.kjv: Speak unto the children of Israel, and bid them that they make them fringes in the borders of their garments throughout their generations, and that they put upon the fringe of the borders a ribband of blue:
verses.web: “Speak to the children of Israel, and tell them that they should make themselves fringes on the borders of their garments throughout their generations, and that they put on the fringe of each border a cord of blue.
verses.ct: "Tell the people of Israel to make tassels on the corners of their garments throughout every generation, with a blue cord woven into each tassel.

verses.kjv: And it shall be unto you for a fringe, that ye may look upon it, and remember all the commandments of the LORD, and do them; and that ye seek not after your own heart and your own eyes, after which ye use to go a whoring:
verses.web: It shall be to you for a fringe, that you may see it, and remember all LORD’s commandments, and do them; and that you don’t follow your own heart and your own eyes, after which you used to play the prostitute;
verses.ct: These tassels will serve as a reminder. Whenever you see them, you'll remember all the LORD's commandments and obey them, instead of chasing after whatever your own hearts and eyes desire — which is how you've been led into unfaithfulness.

verses.kjv: That ye may remember, and do all my commandments, and be holy unto your God.
verses.web: so that you may remember and do all my commandments, and be holy to your God.
verses.ct: This way you'll remember to obey all my commandments and be holy before your God.

verses.kjv: I am the LORD your God, which brought you out of the land of Egypt, to be your God: I am the LORD your God.
verses.web: I am LORD your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, to be your God: I am LORD your God.”
verses.ct: I am the LORD your God, who brought you out of Egypt to be your God. I am the LORD your God."
